reviews.title: Location Can't be beat!

reviews.text: Rooms are spacious and clean.

reviews.title: WOW - Absolutely loved it

likes.disliked: — The hotel does do car parking for nominal fee but tell them when you book you need it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did some shopping and found this hotel to be about $100 less per night than the other hotels in the area.
reviews.title: HONEYMOON IN BOSTON

reviews.text: We look forward to returning because we learned that the hotel is under going a complete make over. The new owners are going modern with the decor which will be finished next spring.
reviews.title: Nightmare on State St!

reviews.text: Fabulous location, but room was noisy, hot, and in slight disrepair. I'd stay again if I had to, but would probably look elsewhere first.
reviews.title: Just okay.

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for three nights as part of a USA winter holiday and I would really recommend it based purely on the location. I would agree with all of the previous reviews that the location is just spot on - especially for nightlife - pubs and restaurants are within easy walking distance. I had previously stayed at the Omni Parker and preferred the location of the Harborside.
reviews.title: Good Value
Excellant Stay
reviews.text: Due to previous reviews I faxed the hotel to request a quiet room and did not receive a reply. However on check in we were able to switch to an atrium room. This was fairly quiet, however, the atrium does have a strange echo effect so even a sneeze on the ground floor reverberated around. The room we were in also had very little natural light despite windows to the atrium.
We didn't find the area particularly noisy and were disappointed not to see any Ho's (see previous review) but there seemed to be lots of "frat boys" around - students to us Brits!
reviews.title: Location, Location, Location!!!!!!!!!

reviews.text: The decor was ok, but the coffee in the lobby was either cold or empty. Far better to go to Dunkin Donuts two blocks up.The subway is right outside the hotel, but you might struggle if you have heavy cases.
reviews.title: Great location, interesting rooms - a little noisy at weekends

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I had intended to spend a romantic weekend at the Harborside Inn in Boston recently. We had reason to have high expectations since a previous stay last June had been very pleasant. However, that experience was not repeated.
reviews.title: Sad times at the Harborside Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We checked in, changed, and set out for a night on the town, returning to the hotel at about 1:15 a.m. The first surprize was that all of the bars in the neighborhood were overflowing with raucous, screaming college students. (This hadn't been the case at all in June.) The front step of the hotel was covered in vomit. We tried to enter the hotel to escape the very unpleasant street scene, but found the door to be locked. Just then we were approached by a young man who identified himself as the hotel night clerk who informed us that he had come outside to clean up the vomit but had forgotten his keys! We asked him what we should do - wait for him to get the door open, or go find another hotel. He replied "I really don't know what to tell you" and walked away.
reviews.title: Good - but be careful of the noise!!
It was fine, great location
reviews.text: After standing outside for almost an hour weighing our options (we had no reservation anywhere else, and all our luggage was locked inside along with our car keys), we were finally let back into the hotel by another guest who had been awakened by the impromtu street party and come downstairs to investigate.

The next morning we checked out, determined to find a different hotel and salvage the weekend. I told the desk clerk about our ordeal and asked what sort of compensation the hotel would provide. She pled ignorance of the whole affair, and took down all my contact information, saying that the hotel would be in touch.
reviews.title: Great location, but ask for the right room!
We liked the Harborside!
reviews.text: I waited a week. No calls, no emails, no apologies. Finally, I called the hotel and asked the manager why they hadn't contacted me and what sort of compensation they would provide. The best excuse he could come up with was that they had lost my contact information! (They had managed to bill me, however.) Eventually, he promised to provide a full refund and hung up. Still no apology. Someone needs to remind these folks that being in the 'hospitality business' occasionally requires genuine hospitality.

We returned today from a 4 day stay at the Harborside Inn in the downtown area of Boston and had a very pleasant stay. Location, location, location says it all. It was close to everything! The T aquarium stop right across the street, Quincy market literally 1 block away , the waterfront , and wonderful restaurants in the North end area .
reviews.title: Would definitely recommend Harborside Inn
Consider other hotels
reviews.text: Our room was an atrium room and it was clean and comfortable. I had no problem what so ever connecting with the high speed internet . The room was always cleaned when we got back from a long day of sight seeing and the temperature comfortable. In the lobby they have available coffee and hot water for tea. It was nice just to be able to go down to the lobby and go back to the room without going outside. The staff at the front desk was very knowledgable and were helpful! They even helped me fix a minor suitcase problem! For 2 gals touring Boston for the first time it was a great vacation. They have all the visitors pamphlets in the lobby to help you plan your day. I would stay here again in the future.

reviews.title: super location but...
reviews.text: Pros:

reviews.title: Filthy - Hairs in bathroom, bed, and all over carpet!
reviews.text: -Location to Quincy Market; shopping; good food; harbor pier
-Wireless Internet access
reviews.title: Would stay here again but..................

reviews.text: We stayed at Harborside Inn for a weekend during Feb 2006 in room/suite 16. We are told that this is their best room. There is a picture on their website. Our goal for this trip was to find a moderately priced room near downtown with a water view. Harborside was good for this. It certainly wasn’t luxurious, but we didn’t pay for luxury. The room was large enough. It had a second level loft with an additional bed and TV. We didn’t need this, but we chose to pay a few dollars more to be on the highest floor. The bath had just enough space. It could use another shelf and a towel rack/ring next to the sink. The staff was very friendly and helpful with a can do/will do attitude. One gentleman took time to write out a full page of complicated directions for us. The continental breakfast was a little better than expected. A nice touch was the cinnamon French toast (you could reheat in toaster) with maple syrup, hardboiled eggs and ham. The breakfast room was cozy and we felt right at home. Coffee was ready early and available all day. The location is convenient and there is plenty of parking. I didn’t see an elevator, so you may want to ask about that if you have trouble with stairs. One thing this inn falls short on is housekeeping. The sink and mirror were covered with splashed toothpaste upon arrival. The bed linens were clean and everything else seemed fine, so I think they just forgot to clean the sink. They also failed to replace the towels they took during Saturday cleaning. Overall, I feel the price matches the accommodations, but Harborside definitely has to make a housekeeping adjustment.
reviews.title: Good Stay, Great Staff, Convenient

reviews.text: Stayed at the Harborside in January for four nights. I had the cheapest room which is a two level suite overlooking the Christie's Wharf parking lot. The room contained a queen sized bed on the first level and another on the second level. Second level loft room had a tiny closet and a nightstand plus the bed with not much room. The first level had a couch sitting area, closet with a mini fridge inside, trunk at the end of the bed, and TV with DVD player. A set of French doors opened to a narrow balcony with two chairs that would be great for relaxing and people watching in the summer but I kept them closed as it was very cold. The bathroom was small with a pedestal sink. Towels and provided soap, shampoo, lotion, etc. was fine.
reviews.title: Harborside Inn - Very decent
A pleasant surprise
reviews.text: Afternoon cookies and continental breakfast were served in a common room down the hallway. One note about the free wireless internet. You had to get a coupon from the front desk that would give you a logon name and password but I was never able to even get to the logon screen even though my computer showed an excellent wireless connection. So that proved to be worthless. If you are going to offer free WiFi just make it free without the hassle. The location is great as you are walking distance to all of the harbor front restaurants and shops. Parking was right in front and I never used my car other than when I went to the mansions. I would stay here again as it was an excellent value.
